00054 //
00055 // Material Description
00056 //              See Chapter 13, page 471 for a discussion on Materials
00058 
00059 class Material
00060 {
00061         D3DMATERIAL9 m_D3DMaterial;
00062 public:
00063         Material();
00064         void SetAmbient(const Color &color);
00065         void SetDiffuse(const Color &color);
00066         void SetSpecular(const Color &color, const float power);
00067         void SetEmissive(const Color &color);
00068         void Set(const Color &color);
00069         void SetAlpha(const float alpha);
00070         bool HasAlpha() const { return GetAlpha() != fOPAQUE; }
00071         float GetAlpha() const { return m_D3DMaterial.Diffuse.a; }
00072         void Use();
00073 };

00078 //
00079 // AlphaType Description
00080 //
00081 //   This enum defines the different types of alpha blending
00082 //   types that can be set on a scene node.
00083 //
00085 
00086 enum AlphaType
00087 {
00088         AlphaOpaque,
00089         AlphaTexture,
00090         AlphaMaterial,
00091         AlphaVertex
00092 };
00093 
00094 
00096 // SceneNodeProperties Description
00097 //
00098 //   This class is contained in the SceneNode class, and gains
00099 //   easy access to common scene node properties such as its ActorId
00100 //   or render pass, with a single ISceneNode::VGet() method.
00101 //
00103 
00104 class SceneNodeProperties
00105 {
00106         friend class SceneNode;
00107 
00108 protected:
00109         optional<ActorId>               m_ActorId;
00110         std::string                             m_Name;
00111         Mat4x4                                  m_ToWorld, m_FromWorld;
00112         float                                   m_Radius;
00113         RenderPass                              m_RenderPass;
00114         Material                                m_Material;
00115         AlphaType                               m_AlphaType;
00116 
00117         void SetAlpha(const float alpha) 
00118                 { m_AlphaType=AlphaMaterial; m_Material.SetAlpha(alpha); } 
00119 
00120 public:
00121         optional<ActorId> const &ActorId() const { return m_ActorId; }
00122         Mat4x4 const &ToWorld() const { return m_ToWorld; }
00123         Mat4x4 const &FromWorld() const { return m_FromWorld; }
00124         void Transform(Mat4x4 *toWorld, Mat4x4 *fromWorld) const;
00125 
00126         const char * Name() const { return m_Name.c_str(); }            
00127 
00128         bool HasAlpha() const { return m_Material.HasAlpha(); }                                         
00129         float Alpha() const { return m_Material.GetAlpha(); }
00130         AlphaType AlphaType() const { return m_AlphaType; }
00131 
00132         RenderPass RenderPass() const { return m_RenderPass; }
00133         float Radius() const { return m_Radius; }
00134 
00135         Material const &Material() const { return m_Material; }
00136 };
00137 
00139 //
00140 // SceneNodeList Description
00141 //
00142 //   Every scene node has a list of its children - this 
00143 //   is implemented as a vector since it is expected that
00144 //   we won't add/delete nodes very often, and we'll want 
00145 //   fast random access to each child.
00146 //
00148 
00149 typedef std::vector<shared_ptr<ISceneNode> > SceneNodeList;
00150 
00151 
00153 //
00154 // SceneNode Description
00155 //
00156 //   Implements ISceneNode. Forms the base class for any node
00157 //   that can exist in the 3D scene graph managed by class Scene.
00158 //
00160 
00161 class SceneNode : public ISceneNode
00162 {
00163         friend class Scene;
00164 
00165 protected:
00166         SceneNodeList                   m_Children;
00167         SceneNode                               *m_pParent;
00168         SceneNodeProperties             m_Props;
00169 
00170 public:
00171         SceneNode(optional<ActorId> actorId, std::string name, RenderPass renderPass, const Mat4x4 *to, const Mat4x4 *from=NULL) 
00172         { 
00173                 m_pParent= NULL;
00174                 m_Props.m_ActorId = actorId;
00175                 m_Props.m_Name = name;
00176                 m_Props.m_RenderPass = renderPass;
00177                 m_Props.m_AlphaType = AlphaOpaque;
00178                 VSetTransform(to, from); 
00179                 SetRadius(0);
00180         }
00181 
00182         virtual ~SceneNode();
00183 
00184         virtual const SceneNodeProperties * const VGet() const { return &m_Props; }
00185 
00186         virtual HRESULT VPreRender(Scene *pScene);
00187         virtual HRESULT VRender(Scene *pScene);
00188         virtual HRESULT VPostRender(Scene *pScene);
00189 
00190         virtual void VSetTransform(const Mat4x4 *toWorld, const Mat4x4 *fromWorld=NULL);
00191 
00192         virtual bool VAddChild(shared_ptr<ISceneNode> kid);
00193         virtual bool VRemoveChild(ActorId id);
00194         virtual HRESULT VRenderChildren(Scene *pScene);
00195         virtual HRESULT VOnRestore(Scene *pScene);
00196         virtual bool VIsVisible(Scene *pScene) const;
00197 
00198         virtual HRESULT VOnUpdate(Scene *, DWORD const elapsedMs);
00199 
00200         virtual void SetAlpha(float alpha) { return m_Props.SetAlpha(alpha); }
00201 
00202         Vec3 GetPosition() const { return m_Props.m_ToWorld.GetPosition(); }
00203         void SetPosition(const Vec3 &pos) { m_Props.m_ToWorld.SetPosition(pos); }
00204 
00205         void SetRadius(const float radius) { m_Props.m_Radius = radius; }
00206         void SetMaterial(const Material &mat) { m_Props.m_Material = mat; }
00207 
00208 };

00211 //
00212 // AlphaSceneNode Description
00213 // AlphaSceneNodes Description
00214 //
00215 // A list of scene nodes that need to be drawn in the alpha pass;
00216 // the list is defined as an STL list
00218 
00219 struct AlphaSceneNode
00220 {
00221         shared_ptr<ISceneNode> m_pNode;
00222         Mat4x4 m_Concat;
00223         float m_ScreenZ;
00224 
00225         // For the STL sort...
00226         bool const operator <(AlphaSceneNode const &other) { return m_ScreenZ < other.m_ScreenZ; }
00227 };
00228 
00229 typedef std::list<AlphaSceneNode *> AlphaSceneNodes;
00230

00233 //
00234 // SceneActorMap Description
00235 //
00236 //   An STL map that allows fast lookup of a scene node given an ActorId.
00237 //
00239 
00240 typedef std::map<ActorId, shared_ptr<ISceneNode> > SceneActorMap;

00244 //
00245 // Scene Description
00246 //
00247 // A heirarchical container of scene nodes, which
00248 // are classes that implemente the ISceneNode interface
00249 //
00251 
00252 class CameraNode;
00253 class SkyNode;
00254 
00255 class Scene
00256 {
00257 protected:
00258         shared_ptr<SceneNode>   m_Root;
00259         shared_ptr<CameraNode>  m_Camera;
00260         ID3DXMatrixStack                *m_MatrixStack;
00261         AlphaSceneNodes                 m_AlphaSceneNodes;
00262         SceneActorMap                   m_ActorMap;
00263 
00264         void RenderAlphaPass();
00265 
00266 public:
00267 
00268         Scene();
00269         virtual ~Scene();
00270 
00271         HRESULT OnRender();
00272         HRESULT OnRestore();
00273         HRESULT OnUpdate(const int deltaMilliseconds);
00274         shared_ptr<ISceneNode> FindActor(ActorId id);
00275         bool AddChild(optional<ActorId> id, shared_ptr<ISceneNode> kid)
00276         { 
00277                 if (id.valid())
00278                 {
00279                         // This allows us to search for this later based on actor id
00280                         m_ActorMap[*id] = kid;  
00281                 }
00282                 return m_Root->VAddChild(kid); 
00283         }
00284 
00285         bool RemoveChild(ActorId id)
00286         { 
00287                 m_ActorMap.erase(id);
00288                 return m_Root->VRemoveChild(id); 
00289         }
00290 
00291         void SetCamera(shared_ptr<CameraNode> camera) { m_Camera = camera; }
00292         const shared_ptr<CameraNode> GetCamera() const { return m_Camera; }
00293 
00294         void PushAndSetMatrix(const Mat4x4 &toWorld)
00295         {
00296                 // Note this code carefully!!!!! It is COMPLETELY different
00297                 // from some DirectX 9 documentation out there....
00298                 // Scene::PushAndSetMatrix - Chapter 14, page 510
00299 
00300                 m_MatrixStack->Push();
00301                 m_MatrixStack->MultMatrixLocal(&toWorld);
00302                 DXUTGetD3DDevice()->SetTransform(D3DTS_WORLD, m_MatrixStack->GetTop());
00303         }
00304 
00305         void PopMatrix() 
00306         {
00307                 // Scene::PopMatrix - Chapter 14, page 510
00308                 m_MatrixStack->Pop(); 
00309                 DXUTGetD3DDevice()->SetTransform(D3DTS_WORLD, m_MatrixStack->GetTop()); 
00310         }
00311 
00312         const Mat4x4 *GetTopMatrix() 
00313         { 
00314                 // Scene::GetTopMatrix - Chapter 14, page 510
00315                 return static_cast<const Mat4x4 *>(m_MatrixStack->GetTop()); 
00316         }
00317 
00318         void AddAlphaSceneNode(AlphaSceneNode *asn) { m_AlphaSceneNodes.push_back(asn); }
00319 };

00322 //
00323 // RootNode Description
00324 //
00325 //    This is the root node of the scene graph.
00326 //
00328 
00329 class RootNode : public SceneNode
00330 {
00331 public:
00332         RootNode();
00333         virtual bool VAddChild(shared_ptr<ISceneNode> kid);
00334         virtual bool VRemoveChild(ActorId id);
00335         virtual HRESULT VRenderChildren(Scene *pScene);
00336         virtual bool VIsVisible(Scene *pScene) const { return true; }
00337 };

00343 //
00344 // CameraNode Description
00345 //
00346 //    A camera node controls the D3D view transform and holds the view
00347 //    frustum definition
00348 //
00350 
00351 class CameraNode : public SceneNode
00352 {
00353 public:
00354         CameraNode(Mat4x4 const *t, Frustum const &frustum) 
00355          : SceneNode(optional_empty(), "Camera", RenderPass_0, t),
00356            m_Frustum(frustum),
00357            m_bActive(true),
00358            m_DebugCamera(false)
00359         { 
00360         }
00361 
00362         virtual HRESULT VRender(Scene *pScene);
00363         virtual HRESULT VOnRestore(Scene *pScene);
00364         virtual bool VIsVisible(Scene *pScene) const { return m_bActive; }
00365 
00366         virtual HRESULT SetView(Scene *pScene);
00367 
00368         const Frustum &GetFrustum() { return m_Frustum; }
00369         void SetTarget(shared_ptr<SceneNode> pTarget)
00370         {
00371                 m_pTarget = pTarget;
00372         }
00373 
00374         void ClearTarget() { m_pTarget.clear(); }
00375 
00376 protected:
00377 
00378         Frustum                 m_Frustum;
00379     Mat4x4                      m_Projection;
00380         bool                    m_bActive;
00381         bool                    m_DebugCamera;
00382         optional< shared_ptr<SceneNode> > m_pTarget;
00383 };

00423 //
00424 // Grid Description
00425 //
00426 //    A slightly modified version of Grid from 
00427 //       the beginning 3D chapter
00428 //
00430 
00431 class Grid : public SceneNode
00432 {
00433 protected:
00434         GridParams                              m_params;                       // Grid creation parameters
00435         LPDIRECT3DTEXTURE9              m_pTexture;                     // the grid texture for the axes planes
00436         LPDIRECT3DVERTEXBUFFER9 m_pVerts;                       // the grid verts
00437         LPDIRECT3DINDEXBUFFER9  m_pIndices;                     // the grid index
00438         DWORD                                   m_numVerts;
00439         DWORD                                   m_numPolys;
00440 
00441 public:
00442         bool                                    m_bTextureHasAlpha;
00443 
00444         Grid(optional<ActorId> actorId, std::string name, const GridParams &params);
00445         virtual ~Grid();
00446         HRESULT VOnRestore(Scene *pScene);
00447         HRESULT VRender(Scene *pScene);
00448         bool VHasAlpha() const { return m_bTextureHasAlpha; }
00449 };

00455 // ArrowNode Description
00456 //

00459 //     in a lot of the figures!
00460 //

00464 {
00465 protected:
00466         ID3DXMesh *m_shaft;

00469         Mat4x4 m_shaftTrans;
00470         
00471 public:
00472         ArrowNode(std::string name, const float length, const Mat4x4 *t, const Color &color);
00473 
00474         virtual ~ArrowNode() { SAFE_RELEASE(m_shaft); SAFE_RELEASE(m_cone); }
00475         virtual HRESULT VRender(Scene *pScene);
00476 };

00482 // SkyNode Description
00483 //
00484 //    Implements a believable sky that follows
00485 //        the camera around
00486 //
00488 
00489 class SkyNode : public SceneNode
00490 {
00491 protected:
00492         LPDIRECT3DTEXTURE9              m_pTexture[5];          // the sky textures
00493         LPDIRECT3DVERTEXBUFFER9 m_pVerts;                       // the sky verts
00494         DWORD                                   m_numVerts;
00495         DWORD                                   m_sides;
00496         const char *                    m_textureBaseName;
00497         shared_ptr<CameraNode>  m_camera;
00498         bool                                    m_bActive;
00499 
00500 public:
00501         SkyNode(const char *textureFile, shared_ptr<CameraNode> camera);
00502         virtual ~SkyNode();
00503         HRESULT VOnRestore(Scene *pScene);
00504         HRESULT VRender(Scene *pScene);
00505         HRESULT VPreRender(Scene *pScene);
00506         bool VIsVisible(Scene *pScene) const { return m_bActive; }
00507 
00508 };

00512 //
00513 // TestObject Description
00514 //
00515 //    Implements a test object that has no symmetry on X, Y, and Z axes.
00516 //    Really useful to make sure you haven't flipped left-handed versus
00517 //    right handed coordinate systems or something like that
00518 //
00520 
00521 class TriangleIterator;
00522 struct TestObjectParams;
00523

00529         DWORD                                   m_numPolys;
00530 
00531         DWORD                                   m_color;
00532 
00533 public:
00534         TestObject(TestObjectParams const &p, std::string name);
00535         virtual ~TestObject();
00536         HRESULT VOnRestore(Scene *pScene);
00537         HRESULT VRender(Scene *pScene);
00538 
00539         TriangleIterator *CreateTriangleIterator();
00540 
00541         static WORD g_TestObjectIndices[][4];
00542         static Vec3 g_TestObjectVerts[];
00543 };

00551 //    Implements a WASD style movement controller
00552 //
00554 
00555 class MovementController : public IMouseHandler, public IKeyboardHandler
00556 {
00557 protected:
00558         Mat4x4  m_matFromWorld;
00559         Mat4x4  m_matToWorld;
00560     Mat4x4  m_matPosition;
00561 
00562         CPoint                                  m_lastMousePos;
00563         BYTE                                    m_bKey[256];                    // Which keys are up and down
00564 
00565         // Orientation Controls
00566         float           m_fTargetYaw;
00567         float           m_fTargetPitch;
00568         float           m_fYaw;
00569         float           m_fPitch;
00570         float           m_fPitchOnDown;
00571         float           m_fYawOnDown;
00572         float           m_maxSpeed;
00573         float           m_currentSpeed;
00574 
00575         shared_ptr<SceneNode> m_object;
00576 
00577 public:
00578         MovementController(shared_ptr<SceneNode> object, float initialYaw, float initialPitch);
00579         void SetObject(shared_ptr<SceneNode> newObject);
00580 
00581         void OnUpdate(DWORD const elapsedMs);
00582 
00583 public:
00584         bool VOnMouseMove(const CPoint &mousePos);
00585         bool VOnLButtonDown(const CPoint &mousePos);
00586         bool VOnLButtonUp(const CPoint &mousePos);
00587         bool VOnRButtonDown(const CPoint &) { return false; }
00588         bool VOnRButtonUp(const CPoint &) { return false; }
00589 
00590         bool VOnKeyDown(const BYTE c) { m_bKey[c] = true; return true; }
00591         bool VOnKeyUp(const BYTE c) { m_bKey[c] = false; return true; }
00592 
00593         const Mat4x4 *GetToWorld() { return &m_matToWorld; }
00594         const Mat4x4 *GetFromWorld() { return &m_matFromWorld; }        
00595 };
